snippet: Abdul Basit Usman, who pledged allegiance to the Islamic State, was accused of carrying out multiple bombings in the southern Philippines beginning in 2002.
abstract: Master Filipino bomb-maker Abdul Basit Usman, who had declared loyalty to Islamic State, is killed in gun battle; it is unclear wheter $1 million bounty offered by United States was factor in his death.
lead_paragraph: Abdul Basit Usman, who pledged allegiance to the Islamic State, was accused of carrying out multiple bombings in the southern Philippines beginning in 2002.

headline.main: Filipino Bomb Maker, Sought by U.S., Is Said to Die in Fight With Rebels
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Asia; Philippines: Master Bomb Maker,Subject of $1 Million Bounty, Is Killed

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
